recipe_name: Crisp beef and noodle rolls with soy and honey sauce
author: Paul Rankin
method: For the crisp beef and noodle roll, heat one tablespoon of the oil in a frying pan over a high heat. Add the beef strips, season with freshly ground black pepper and fry for 2-3 minutes, or until browned and cooked to your taste. Remove from the pan. Wrap the beef strips in the cooked rice noodles.  Heat the remaining oil in the same frying pan over a medium heat. Fry the noodle parcels for 3-4 minutes, or until crisp and golden-brown. Remove from the pan and drain on kitchen paper.  For the soy and honey sauce, heat the sesame oil, soy sauce, honey and lime juice in a small saucepan over a medium heat and cook for 3-4 minutes until the liquid has reduced slightly.  To serve, place the crispy beef and noodle rolls and the steamed broccoli onto a serving plate. Pour the soy and honey sauce into a dipping bowl and serve on the side.
ingredients: 3 tbsp vegetable oil,  100g/3½oz sirloin steak, cut into strips,  freshly ground black pepper,  100g/3½oz rice noodles, cooked according to packet instructions, drained,  1 tbsp sesame oil,  2 tbsp soy sauce,  1 tbsp runny honey,  1 lime, juice only,  85g/3oz broccoli, steamed
